articles.title: Asia stocks subdued, oil caps stellar year By Reuters - Investing.com
articles.description: Asia stocks subdued, oil caps stellar year
articles.content:
By Wayne Cole
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Asian shares flatlined on a slow Thursday as the spread of Omicron clouded what is the last trading day of the year for many exchanges, while oil was close to finish… [+3312 chars]

articles.author: Eustance Huang
articles.title: Asia-Pacific stocks mostly rise; SenseTime jumps in Hong Kong debut - CNBC
articles.description: The S&P 500 sailed to its 70th record close of 2021 overnight stateside. The Dow Jones Industrial Average also notched a record close.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE Shares in Asia-Pacific were mostly higher in Thursday trade after gains overnight on Wall Street led to a record close for both the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average.

articles.title: Chinese netizens scold Bobby Au-yeung for celebrating Christmas because the holiday is 'only for foreigners' - AsiaOne
articles.description: Who knew donning a Santa hat and having your own Christmas tree would incite backlash online? Hong Kong actor Bobby Au-yeung certainly didn't. Last Friday (Dec 24), the 61-year old uploaded two videos onto Douyin, TikTok's sister app in China, in celebration …

articles.title: AirAsia completes RM974.5mil rights issue - The Star Online
articles.description: KUALA LUMPUR: AirAsia Group Bhd is expected to complete its renounceable rights issue to its existing shareholders upon the listing of the redeemable convertible unsecured Islamic debt securities (RCUIDS) and warrants on Dec 31.
